question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Memory: String allocation] [Excessive cloning] Checker names are compared as Strings - are names cloned unnecessarily during comparison, causing excessive allocations for large checker sets? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Error: expect() panic] [Crash vulnerability] The expect() call on line 59 panics if Options extension is missing - can attackers trigger compilation without properly initialized GlobalEnv to cause compiler crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Error: Checker panic] [Uncaught exception] If lint.check() panics (line 40), is the panic caught and handled, or does it crash the entire compilation preventing other functions from being validated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Error: get_name() failure] [String corruption] If lint.get_name() returns invalid UTF-8 or panics (line 72), can this cause the filter operation to crash or behave unpredictably? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Error: known_checker_names] [Inconsistent state] If known_checker_names() returns an inconsistent set compared to actual checkers (line 63), can this cause valid checkers to be incorrectly skipped or unknown checkers to execute? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Error: lint_skips_from_attributes failure] [Silent error] If lint_skips_from_attributes encounters errors parsing attributes (lines 82-86), does it fail silently returning empty set, potentially causing security checks to unexpectedly execute? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Type: dyn StacklessBytecodeChecker] [Virtual dispatch] The checker trait objects use dynamic dispatch - can attackers exploit vtable corruption or type confusion in the dyn dispatch to execute arbitrary methods? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Type: FunctionData] [Invariant violation] FunctionData is moved into and returned from process() - if checkers modify internal state in ways that violate FunctionData invariants, can this corrupt subsequent pipeline stages? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Type: BTreeSet<String>] [Comparison semantics] BTreeSet uses Ord trait for String - can locale-specific string comparisons cause inconsistent skip set membership across different compilation environments? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Type: FunctionTarget] [Borrow semantics] FunctionTarget borrows func_env and data - if the borrow checker's lifetime analysis is incorrect, could this allow use-after-free of function metadata? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Type: Option<&[FunctionEnv]>] [Null dereference] The _scc_opt parameter is Option type but unused - if future code dereferences it without checking, could this cause null pointer dereferences? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Concurrency: FunctionTargetsHolder] [Race condition] The mutable reference to FunctionTargetsHolder (line 26) could be accessed by multiple processors concurrently - are there data races if multiple threads process different functions simultaneously? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Concurrency: GlobalEnv access] [Shared state mutation] The GlobalEnv is accessed via target.global_env() (line 57) - if checkers mutate global state, can race conditions cause inconsistent validation results across functions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Concurrency: Options extension] [Cache invalidation] Options is retrieved from GlobalEnv extension (line 58) - if Options is modified concurrently, can cached checker pipelines become stale or inconsistent? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Concurrency: Arc<dyn ExternalChecks>] [Interior mutability] Arc provides shared ownership but not synchronization - if ExternalChecks implementations use interior mutability, can unsynchronized mutations corrupt checker state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Concurrency: lint_skips computation] [TOCTOU] The lint_skips are computed once (line 64) but used later (line 72) - can concurrent attribute modifications between these points cause time-of-check-time-of-use vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Validation: Checker names] [Injection attack] Checker names from get_name() are used without sanitization - can malicious names containing special characters exploit string processing bugs in filtering or reporting? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Validation: Attribute data] [Malformed input] Attributes from get_attributes() are parsed without apparent validation - can malformed attribute AST nodes exploit parsing vulnerabilities in lint_skips_from_attributes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Validation: known_checker_names] [Set membership] The known_checker_names set is trusted for validation - if this set is corrupted or incomplete, can attackers bypass validation by using unknown checker names? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Validation: FunctionData integrity] [Bytecode corruption] FunctionData is passed through without validation - if data contains corrupted bytecode, can checkers crash or produce incorrect results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Validation: Module environment] [Metadata spoofing] Module and function environments are accessed via target - if these contain attacker-controlled metadata, can this mislead lint checks or bypass validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [AuthZ: Primary target check] [Privilege bypass] The is_primary_target() check (line 35) determines which code gets linted - can attackers manipulate module classification to elevate non-primary code to avoid security scrutiny? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [AuthZ: Native function exemption] [Privilege escalation] Native functions are exempted from linting (line 31) - can attackers mark malicious functions as native in module metadata to bypass all security checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [AuthZ: Skip attribute] [Permission override] Functions can use skip attributes to bypass specific checkers - are there sufficient controls preventing critical security checkers from being skipped? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [AuthZ: External checker registration] [Trusted input] External checkers are provided via Options.external_checks - is there validation ensuring only trusted checker implementations are registered, or can attackers inject malicious checkers? (Critical)
